official_title: A bill to provide for the reconstruction and rehabilitation of the Martin Luther King Bridge over the Mississippi River connecting the cities of St. Louis, Missouri, and East St. Louis, Illinois, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Authorizes the Secretary of Transportation to make a grant to the Highway Department of the State of Missouri for the reconstruction and rehabilitation of the Martin Luther King Bridge over the Mississippi River which connects the cities of Saint Louis, Missouri, and East Saint Louis, Illinois. Provides that the acquisition of land and interests in land necessary for such project shall be the full expense of the Missouri highway department. Prohibits the Secretary from making the grant until the States have agreed upon the plans for the bridge reconstruction and rehabilitation under the General Bridge Act of 1946 and have given adequate assurances that such bridge and its approaches will be maintained by them. Authorizes appropriations after September 30, 1982, as necessary to carry out the provisions of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the reconstruction and rehabilitation of the Martin Luther King Bridge over the Mississippi River connecting the cities of St. Louis, Missouri, and East St. Louis, Illinois, and for other purposes.
